In this resource you will learn more about women who shaped the perception of Paris and called this beautiful city their home. The goal of this resource is to learn more about Parisians and their inspiring lives. The learning resource is presented on a website with images taken from the Europeana catalogue. It is an example of stories derived from Europeanas extensive collection and the opportunities that data sharing hold.

</Figure>

## Learning outcomes

After completing this resource, learners will be able to:

* describe the patron saint of Paris
* explain why Heloise and Abelard were only reunited in death
* discuss the importance of Getrude Stein for the Avant-Garde movement
* outline the significance of PÃ©re Lachaise Cemetery for the historical figure
